More Notes: Inflation is proxied by food prices; positive indicates worsening food insecurity
Rising per capita GDP reduces food insecurity; positive indicates improvement
A 1% change in CO2 emissions will lead to an 18.3% change in the prevalence of malnutrition

Indicates the significance of global warming as a driver of food security challenges. Specifically CO2 emissions are positively correlated with higher per capita GDP and substantially raise the incidence of malnutrition, thereby worsening food insecurity. This is a minimum bound, the value is greater than this.
